habitually there is a different storage practices in our state
naturally food produced can be damaged by punji plants
rats and bacteria
to overcome this problem the farmers dry the grains for 2-3 days in sun
after drying they keep the grains in a jute bag & preserve them in a godown
Have you ever seen farmers harvesting the crops on roads in some villages farmers harvest their crops on the roads instead of using blokes?
It is a dangerous practice, sometimes accidents may occur.
After the drying process is completed, the grain is filled in the gunny or jute bags and preserved in the go downs or warehouses.
It is a cold storage unit. Here the vegetables, fruits, tration chilees and other products are stored.
